summary:
Dr. Marco Bril is an assistant professor of Psycholinguistics and French Linguistics at Utrecht University. His research mainly focuses on the (L1, L2, L3 and bilingual) language acquisition process, its relation to language competences and implications for educational and clinical practices. In line with his research interests, Marco teaches several BA and MA courses on language acquisition theory, language education and experimental research. Furthermore, he supervises BA, MA and PhD research projects. He is also the curriculum coordinator of the French language and culture department, the MA thesis coordinator of the language department of Graduate School of Teaching and researcher within the Institute for Language Sciences. For the Dutch Association of Linguistics (Algemene Vereniging voor Taalwetenschap), the international association of generative linguistics (GLOW) and the international Going Romance conference Marco is an active board member. He is also reviewer for some international scientific journals (e.g., International Journal of Listening, Language Acquisition and Journal of the European Second Language Association). 
 
For more information: https://www.uu.nl/medewerkers/MBril
